title: Daily StandUp
question: Oh no, the project leader was late to the meeting again! What do you do?

alternatives.answer: Nothing, we can wait! We've got all time in the world.
alternatives.consequence: Well, something should be done. This behaviour can't continue.

alternatives.answer: The person who is late for a meeting has to pay 1$, which is shared by the team.
alternatives.consequence: That's a great idea! This will encourage the staff to keep comming in time.

alternatives.answer: There has to be some consequences. The project leader has to bake cookies to the next meeting.
alternatives.consequence: Thats a wise decision! Very wise indeed!

title: Customer
question: The customer wonders if you can add a short function two weeks before the hand over. It is critical, she says! What do you do?

alternatives.answer: Of course, we can handle that! We probably need to change the order of priority in the sprint backlog.
alternatives.consequence: Well spoken! Good that you mention that the priorities change. You gain 5 velocity points!

alternatives.answer: Sorry, that's not possible. We have enough to do!
alternatives.consequence: That was not a good answer. You need to make sure the customer is satisfied. You loose 4 velocity points.

alternatives.answer: Forget it! It will be as planned. We work according to the waterfall model.
alternatives.consequence: That answer was not appreciated by the customer. You loose 7 velocity points!
